Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: byte: A byte-array for the service-specific information field. This value may be null.
setServiceSpecificInfo(byte[]).Description: Specify service specific information for the publish session. This is a free-form byte array available to the application to send additional information as part of the discovery operation - it will not be used to determine whether a publish/subscribe match occurs. Optional. Empty by default.

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: boolean: If true the terminate callback will be called when the publish is terminated. Otherwise it will not be called.
setTerminateNotificationEnabled(boolean).Description: Configure whether a publish terminate notification @B_android#net#wifi#aware#DiscoverySessionCallback#onSessionTerminated_E@ is reported back to the callback.

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: int: Publish session type: @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#PUBLISH_TYPE_SOLICITED_E@ or @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#PUBLISH_TYPE_UNSOLICITED_E@ (the default). Value is @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#PUBLISH_TYPE_UNSOLICITED_E@, or @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#PUBLISH_TYPE_SOLICITED_E@
setPublishType(int).Description: Specify the type of the publish session: solicited (aka active - publish packets are transmitted over-the-air), or unsolicited (aka passive - no publish packets are transmitted, a match is made against an active subscribe session whose packets are transmitted over-the-air).

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: int: Lifetime of a publish session in seconds.
setTtlSec(int).Description: Sets the time interval (in seconds) an unsolicited ( @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#Builder#setPublishType_E@) publish session will be alive - broadcasting a packet. When the TTL is reached an event will be generated for @B_android#net#wifi#aware#DiscoverySessionCallback#onSessionTerminated_E@ [unless @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig#Builder#setTerminateNotificationEnabled_E@ disables the callback]. Optional. 0 by default - indicating the session doesn't terminate on its own. Session will be terminated when @B_android#net#wifi#aware#DiscoverySession#close_E@ is called.

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: List: A list of match filter entries (each of which is an arbitrary byte array). This value may be null.
setMatchFilter(java.util.List<byte[]>).Description: The match filter for a publish session. Used to determine whether a service discovery occurred - in addition to relying on the service name. Optional. Empty by default.

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: String: The service name for the publish session. This value must never be null.
setServiceName(java.lang.String).Description: Specify the service name of the publish session. The actual on-air value is a 6 byte hashed representation of this string. The Service Name is a UTF-8 encoded string from 1 to 255 bytes in length. The only acceptable single-byte UTF-8 symbols for a Service Name are alphanumeric values (A-Z, a-z, 0-9), the hyphen ('-'), and the period ('.'). All valid multi-byte UTF-8 characters are acceptable in a Service Name. Must be called - an empty ServiceName is not valid.

build().Description: Build @B_android#net#wifi#aware#PublishConfig_E@ given the current requests made on the builder.

Returns: The builder to facilitate chaining builder.setXXX(..).setXXX(..).
Parameters: boolean: If true, ranging is supported on request of the peer.
setRangingEnabled(boolean).Description: Configure whether the publish discovery session supports ranging and allows peers to measure distance to it. This API is used in conjunction with @B_android#net#wifi#aware#SubscribeConfig#Builder#setMinDistanceMm_E@ and @B_android#net#wifi#aware#SubscribeConfig#Builder#setMaxDistanceMm_E@ to specify a minimum and/or maximum distance at which discovery will be triggered. Optional. Disabled by default - i.e. any peer attempt to measure distance to this device will be refused and discovery will proceed without ranging constraints. The device must support Wi-Fi RTT for this feature to be used. Feature support is checked as described in @B_android#net#wifi#rtt#package-summary_E@.
